document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the genus Drasteria of Central Asia and Kazakhstan with special attention to the adjacent areas (Lepidoptera: Erebidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the genus Drasteria of Central Asia and Kazakhstan with special attention to the adjacent areas (Lepidoptera: Erebidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material :
Lectotype male ( designated here in accordance with ICZN Art. 74) ( Figs. 160–162 ), labelled: “Kuldja | 85 Rckbl.” (brown paper, handwritten), “Origin.” (pink paper, printed), “ex coll. 1/2 | Staudinger” (white paper, printed with handwritten numbers), “ LECTOTYPUS | Leucanitis aberrans | Staudinger, 1888 | Stettin. ent. Ztg 49 (1–3): 49 | Korb, Matov, Volynkin des. |
2016, Feb. 1–4
” (red paper, printed) ( ZMHU )
.
Paralectotypes : 1 female ( ZMHU )
.
Habitat ( Figs. 298, 300, 302, 303 ). Dry lowlands, deserts and semideserts. Elevation: 200–1300 m .
Distribution . Deserts and semideserts of Central Asia: South and Central Kazakhstan , Uzbekistan , Turkmenistan , North-West China and Southern and Central Mongolia . Local.

caption.paragraph:
MAP 21. Distribution map of
Drasteria aberrans ( Staudinger, 1888 )
.
